summary: An Ordinance repealing Ordinance No. 25395, entitled "An Ordinance providing for the improvement of Eighth Avenue South, in the City of Seattle, from the north margin of Charlestown Street to the northerly margin of Duwamish Avenue, by the construction of an asphalt top on the existing roadway twenty (20) feet in width, and the placing of wooden headers thereon, together with such necessary resurfacing of the present street as may be necessary, and the construction of wooden walks, all in accordance with Resolution No. 2909 of the City Council of the City of Seattle, and providing for the payment therefor the mode of "Immediate Payment," as provided by the laws of the State of Washington and the charger and ordinances of the City of Seattle," approved October 20th, 1910 and published October 25th, 1910.
